SD:Updated to new date formats,lower case.
Cosmetic corrections, data from figs. digitized.
Subents 014, 015 added.
2 gas filled spectrometers: 10BF-3 and He3
No description of error analysis.
ET-RR-1 reactor
Absolute transmission measurement.
Prepared from spec. pure fine powders
Data taken from Conf. on Nucl. Cross Sections
for Techn., Knoxville, Oct. 1979, p. 101
By authors: Total cross section at room temp.(20 deg-C)
in the energy range 2.2 eV-0.06 eV was found to
fluctuate near a value of 5.9 +- 0.2 b, which is in
good agreement with the value (6.0+-0.1) b of
D.J.Hughes and J.A.Harvey, Neutron Cross Sections,
Digitizing error
Nothing said about uncertainty
Data from Fig.1 of main ref.
The coherent scattering amplitude at room temp.
(20 deg-C) was calculated from the Bragg cut-offs.
It is in good agreement with the value 7.74 Fermi
of G.E.Bacon, Neutron Diffraction, Oxford press,
Nothing said about uncertainty
The coherent scattering cross section at room temp.
(20 deg-C) is in good agreement with the value
7.53 b of G.E.Bacon, Neutron Diffraction, Oxford
press, 1962.
Nothing said about uncertainty

in the energy range 2.2 eV-0.06 eV was fitted using

Data from Fig.2 of main ref.
The coherent scattering amplitude was determined
from the observed Bragg cut-offs. This value at
room temp. (20 deg-C) is in good agreement with
the value 10.3 Fermi of D.J.Hughes and J.A.Harvey,
Neutron Cross Sections, BNL-325, 2nd ed. 1958 and
G.E.Bacon, Neutron Diffraction, Oxford press, 1962.
Nothing said about uncertainty
The coherent scattering cross section was
determined from the observed Bragg cut-offs. This
value at room temp. (20 deg-C) is in good agreement
with the value (13.2+-0.2) b of D.J.Hughes and
J.A.Harvey, neutron cross sections, BNL-325,
2nd ed., 1958 and G.E.Bacon, Neutron Diffraction,
Oxford press, 1962.
Nothing said about uncertainty

nitrogen temp. (-170 deg-C) for below 0.005 eV

Comment by compiler:
The given expression of total cross section does not
agree with the given fig.2 of Int. Conf. On Nuclear
Cross Sections for Technology, Knoxville, Tennessee,
22-26 Oct 1979. Proceed. publ. as NBS spec.publ.594
in Sept 1980.
Digitizing error
Data from Fig.2 of main ref.
The incoherent elastic scattering cross section
at liquid nitrogen temp. (-170 deg-C) is in
good agreement with the value (4.1+-1.2) b of
P.J.Bendt and I.W.Ruderman, Phys. Rev. 77, 575, 1950.
Nothing said about uncertainty

By authors:
Total cross section at liquid nitrogen temp.
(-170 deg-C) for below 0.005 eV is fluctuating
around a constant value of 0.27 +- 011 b.
This value corresponds
to the Be incoherent scattering cross section since
it has a negligible absorption cross section.
